Job Title: Workforce Analytics Manager - Remote

Location: High Point, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Logistics at full potential. 

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

As the Workforce Analytics Manager, you will help build and execute the workforce analytics strategy based upon the Global HR Reporting strategy. As a part of the Global Workforce Analytics team, you will ensure HR data is enabling leadership to manage the business, make decisions, and enable success. Reporting directly to the Global Workforce Analytics Vice President, you will work within a cross-functional team to deliver, enhance and support reporting and analytics solutions, collaborating with the HR teams supporting reporting Globally as required.

Pay, Benefits And More.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.

What you’ll do on a typical day:


Work closely with VP of Global Workforce Analysts and other key leaders in Corporate as well as C-suite to build-out and deliver a world class HR Workforce Analytics and HR Reporting processes.Design and deliver value-add and innovative reports, dashboards, metrics, and analysis, which will support data driven decisions, by partnering with HR Team and functional leaders, Ensure alignment with global methodologies, metrics, and KPIs as defined by the Global HR reporting teamWork in sync with the Global HR reporting team on all major global projects, and be the lead for global corporate functional HR reporting areas (e.g., HR, Finance, IT, Commercial, etc.)Continuously look for efficiencies and synergies (e.g. develop tools to automate frequent reports, define business process improvements and automation).Partner with the Information Technology team and the Global HR Reporting leader on key deliverables, identifying problems, and recommending solutions.Prioritize work, manage incoming requests, and partner with team members to ensure deliverables are up to the highest standards


What you need to succeed at GXO: 

At a minimum, you’ll need:


5 years of relevant work experience Significant track record in successfully delivering workforce planning and analytics, including performing analysis and interpretation of large volume of data within an HR functionIn depth understanding and experience of HR processes and organizationSignificant experience working with analytics, familiarity with statistical methods (e.g., regression analysis) and BI tools, and advanced skills in data manipulation and transformation Proven leadership and collaboration skills Strong Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, and MS Project)


It’d be great if you also have:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in data driven Business, Finance, HR, Business Analysis, or a related fieldExperience working in a global organizationExtensive track record in building strong relationships with senior stakeholders in the organization Knowledge of statistical methods, trends and benchmarks for People AnalyticsKnowledge of process analysis and continuous improvement tools (Lean, Six Sigma)Proficiency in Success Factors


We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains. 

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

GXO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with GXO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
